Articles.Content:
6 hours ago, Starwaster said:

I think you can still use the J docking port. The form factor of the J is the same isn't it?

The new J parts are slightly larger and use a new texture style so there would be a mismatch trying to use a part from a previous version, and this is just a test version, things like the docking adapter aren't in it yet.

I can`t use english well.... but I suggest something.

About capacity of FuelTanks.

Formerly you tell that reason of low capacity of fueltanks is it is designed for aircrafts, but I think OPT`s parts are good for spacecrafts TOO.

I want you consider about to raise capacity of fueltanks.

Heavy weight of fueltanks with high capacity can be solved in player`s discrtion.
(We can adjust loadage of fueltanks in SPH or VAB)

If you accept this suggestion, OPT will get more possibility
 

 

And...... wil you add J inline docking port again?

Edited February 29, 2016 by Sinopei
Is there a download link anywhere?

On ‎2‎/‎29‎/‎2016 at 8:12 AM, Jimbodiah said:

Is there a download link anywhere?

http://www.This website cannot be used on these forums/download/479n9nm72b5reru/OPT1.8testV4.01.zip

LINKS to MediaFire are banned by the forum, but you can just copy/paste this into your browser's URL bar, and obviously replace the 'This website cannot be used on these forums' part with the text 'MediaFire', to get there.  This was in the original post, by the way, not hidden or anything...

I suppose I should insert the disclaimer:  Navigate to MediaFire at your own risk.  I don't like the site for the same reasons that the Forum banned linking to it, their pop-up ads are frequently inappropriate for the content that one is trying to download (i.e. porn, etc.), or they flat-out contain malware such as viruses or Trojan worms that can infect your computer if you don't have strong anti-malware software installed, which everyone should.  However, just because I don't like the site doesn't mean that others shouldn't be free to make their own choice whether to do business with them.  So, I present the information freely, what you do with it is up to you.

You're welcome. 

'The hell?!?  What, the forum moderators don't even want us using the WORD "MediaFire"?!?  That's just as stupid as people saying "you know who" instead of "Voldemort"!  Oh, and for some reason, they only changed the one instance... makes no sense. 

Edited March 3, 2016 by Neutrinovore
Taking a stand against attempted 'thought policing'.

thanks!

Why not use drop box instead of hiding the link to this mod. I feel like I'm playing in Davinci's Code. hahaha

Edited March 2, 2016 by Jimbodiah

9 hours ago, Jimbodiah said:

thanks!

Why not use drop box instead of hiding the link to this mod. I feel like I'm playing in Davinci's Code. hahaha

The link isn't hidden, it's right there in the first post on the first page, you simply can't click on it because of a forum block, you just have to copy and paste it into your address bar.

Yeah, but is that really usefull? Why not just use a site that is not banned by Squad, like SpacePort? makes life a lot easier for everyone. Or are you guys being paid with free porn access?

 

Edited March 2, 2016 by Jimbodiah

10 minutes ago, Jimbodiah said:

Yeah, but is that really usefull? Why not just use a site that is not banned by Squad, like SpacePort? makes life a lot easier for everyone. Or are you guys being paid with free porn access?

 

Hey it's not up to me, I've no involvement with development of this mod, I'd much prefer if K.Yeon was using GitHub. I don't know why he's using Mediafire, I'm just saying the link isn't hidden, and seriously, how hard is it to copy and paste a link?

We haven't heard from the guy since January so I hope everything is Ok.

LOL, let's agree to disagree.

I hope K is okay and enjoying himself. Awesome mod, my go-to for space planes (but I don't use them often enough).

19 hours ago, M_Ouellette said:

We haven't heard from the guy since January so I hope everything is Ok.

I know, the development of this mod has gone disturbingly silent.  Not a good sign.

I like the design of the stuff in this pack and it's such a shame to see it die.

EDIT: Just noticed the release date for the test release. Nope, nope, nope. Jumping ship. I'm not waiting 5 months for a pre-release, let alone possibly up to a year for a full release.

Edited March 3, 2016 by Shinji-The-Kerbonaut
worst case scenario: someone has to take the 1.7 parts and do their best to mimic the 1.8 properties. keep the wings and engines, but revert to the old k/j factors.

someone who has already downloaded it, like me, might be able too re-upload it on some website.

3 hours ago, Shinji-The-Kerbonaut said:

I like the design of the stuff in this pack and it's such a shame to see it die.

EDIT: Just noticed the release date for the test release. Nope, nope, nope. Jumping ship. I'm not waiting 5 months for a pre-release, let alone possibly up to a year for a full release.

uhhh.... what? you act like the pre-release is diseased or something  whats wrong with it? it works as if it were a full release.
Link for J61 turbo ramjet for 1.0.5?

On 3/3/2016 at 5:30 PM, 123nick said:

someone who has already downloaded it, like me, might be able too re-upload it on some website.

uhhh.... what? you act like the pre-release is diseased or something  whats wrong with it? it works as if it were a full release.

The release date. That wait is too long. I'm pretty much ditching this mod, Mark IV already makes my SSTOs happy.

1 minute ago, Shinji-The-Kerbonaut said:

The release date. That wait is too long. I'm pretty much ditching this mod, Mark IV already makes my SSTOs happy.

but it basically IS released. just use the pre release, it even has "release" in its title. ignore that adjective. i mean, its like KSP itself: sure it was only technically released when 1.0 came out, but really, it was just as good in 0.90. 

edit: you also assume that there will be a release, that may not bee 100% certain. but! the pre release is basically A release.

Edited March 5, 2016 by 123nick
Admit it! You sell used cars for a living!

Recently tested. everything works as advertised and quite incredibly as well. You fixed all the bugs noted in 1.7 and reduced the poly count on most of the models (For the better, they look hot as hell now). Engines are still absurdly over-powered and under-fueled, but you've noted that's for us to tweak. Overall, a mighty slick and impressive mod. I could suggest minor little bits and pieces to add to this, but you've hit all the big nails.

Good job, if I find any bugs, I'll let you know, new favorite aerospace pack. First ship went into orbit like a glove.

1.8 is nice but was hoping for tiny things like being able to use tweakscale on all the parts. as of now you can adjust the wing sizes, but not the corresponding control surfaces. same with the schramjet. how do I get the mk2 ramjet into 1.8?

... why not just use OPT 1.7, then replace the old wings and engines with the 1.8 ones. that's what i've done.
If there are any other updates you can slowly sift the new parts into it (excluding main hull portions) until the release is complete.

I may very well stick to 1.7 hulls simply because they're KSPI compatible, i like the old K cockpit, and i have a billion ships using their parts that i don't wanna loose.

I really don't see the point in keeping anything from 1.8 as it's missing a lot of the parts, and the wings are too buggy to work with: takes me 5 minutes to put on each wing flap on correctly and most of the time they will not line up with the wing in 1 or more axis.

9 hours ago, Jimbodiah said:

I really don't see the point in keeping anything from 1.8 as it's missing a lot of the parts, and the wings are too buggy to work with: takes me 5 minutes to put on each wing flap on correctly and most of the time they will not line up with the wing in 1 or more axis.

The reason he went back to using wings with separate control surfaces is because the ones with integrated surfaces never got their lift ratings right and I don't think there was a way in the game to separate the ratings for wings and controls without making them separate parts.

On 3/5/2016 at 7:21 PM, Shinji-The-Kerbonaut said:

The release date. That wait is too long. I'm pretty much ditching this mod, Mark IV already makes my SSTOs happy.

What release date are you talking about, he released the 1.8 v4.01 on 8/01/2016, ie Jan 8 although he actually released it Jan7, don't confuse 8/01/2016 to mean the next will be in August, although right now who can say?

We can only hope everything is OK with K.Yeon but if this does eventually become an abandoned mod, it is under the creative commons license, so there is nothing stopping someone else from making parts that will fit it.
the mod doesn't appear on CKAN. help

Install it manually.

 

@M_Ouellette I get why the flaps are there, but there should be a node to place the flap on, instead of surface attaching to a highly angled and curved area.
when i try to install it manually all i get is the mystery goo engines and a few other things, but no plane parts
